title: Please Help to find font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161239im_/http:/typophile.com/files/stationary%20logo%20flattened_5798.jpg)

Hello,

I have tried to match the font on my own and think that it is " Calibri", I am certain that it is a match but not the exact font.  
The bottom one is "Arial rounded MT Bold"

I am after the font face of the word "Sign FX".  
Kindly help me to find the correct one.

Thanks in advance.

Regards,  
Hash

Font: 

 ITCFranklin Gothic LT Book Bold 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161239/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: hasnain125

comments.content: "Sign FX" looks like **[ITC Franklin Gothic (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161239/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=ITC%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=ITCFranklinGothic%20LT%20Book%20-%20Bold&fid=d747c111e8f7e14af9fa3cfa11287424&fsize=60&text=sign%20FX&fit=1)**, 10%-20% expanded + the 3d & shine effect.

The bottom line text proportions and general shape are very close to **[Linotype Univers (Extended)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161239/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Linotype%20Univers%20-%20440%20Extended&fid=2726d1555752b70358f93b09a9f94799&fsize=60&text=signs%20designs%20graphics&wrap=2)** but the /a and terminals slope on /c /s don't match.  
It also looks very close to an expanded **[Arial](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317161239/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=MS-Windows-Fonts%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Arial%20-%20Regular&fid=39c85868b4da84331551eae5e6d98715&fsize=60&text=signs%20designs%20graphics&wrap=2)**
